title: Blue Sentinel Journal entry
body:
Gosh, its been too long since I last posted these...

Blue Sentinel marks the end of the standard creatures (and what not), but by no means marks the end. I'm planning far larger entries for the Dragon and Baron Nashor (more details on anatomy, encounter, etc), which means that they'll ultimately take a bit longer, but will be loaded up with all sorts of additional whatnots for your enjoyment.

But for now, enjoy the long awaited Blue Sentinel!!! (Attached)

replies.body:
Awww yiss.

I love these.  The idea of a kind of natural historian of Runeterra is really appealing :)  To the writing, there are some parts where it reads a little less smoothly than others.  For example:

> This would usually result in the Sentinels being damaged almost beyond repair, so a pair of sentries **was** made for each Sentinel who would not only provide early warning for danger but would draw forth energy from the earth faster so that the Sentinels could repair themselves. 

That's quite the sentence!  Also, I think the use of "was" is wrong - and should probably be "were".  I find the use of the words "sentries" and "sentinels" to be quite close too - causing me to have to stop and re-read.  I get them confused :/

The idea still makes my heart sing, though :D  I'm tempted to print them out and make a little bound leaflet!

For what it's worth, "was" is actually the correct choice here. The main subject of that clause is "pair," which is a singular collective noun (with "of sentries" acting as a descriptive adjective phrase), and thus requires the singular verb conjugation. 

 \>.>
